result.execSummary:
The defendant Gustavo A Mendez-Acevedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay a FINE of $100.00 INCLUDING ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES; cash bail on deposit to be applied.

***NOTES/06-22-2015***
Clerk was notified that there is no cash bond posted in this case. Due date for the fine is 09/15/2015 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment. The clerk's office will notify the defendant of the due date.

Court will grant expungement after 1 year if the defendant commits no new offenses or no new crimes which rise to the level of probable cause.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gustavo A Mendez-Acevedo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reminder notice of $100.00 fine due date sent to defendant.

Clerk was notified that there is no cash bond posted on this case.  Due date for the fine is 09/15/2015 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  The clerk's office will notify the defendant of the due date.

Defendant Gustavo A Mendez-Acevedo in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $100.00 INCLUDING ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES; cash bail on deposit to be applied.  Court will grant expungement after 1 year if the defendant commits no new offenses or no new crimes which rise to the level of probable cause.

Defendant Gustavo A Mendez-Acevedo in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea/sentencing date. Court orders case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription, no use of any illegal drugs  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-05-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Gustavo A Mendez-Acevedo
Current: 925 South 19th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 02-13-2015)
Prior: 925 South 19th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204

Defendant Gustavo A Mendez-Acevedo in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.24  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 2/13/15 @ 1 PM
